thread.title: Xiaomi Mi MIX Evo Smartphone With Snapdragon 835 SoC Spotted on Geekbench
thread.title_full: Xiaomi Mi MIX Evo Smartphone With Snapdragon 835 SoC Spotted on Geekbench

title: Xiaomi Mi MIX Evo Smartphone With Snapdragon 835 SoC Spotted on Geekbench
text:
Xiaomi Mi MIX Evo Smartphone With Snapdragon 835 SoC Spotted on Geekbench The name suggests the phone might be a variant of Xiaomi Mi Mix Listing suggests the smartphone runs Android 6.0.1 Marshmallow Xiaomi announced white colour variant of Xiaomi Mi Mix earlier this month 
A new smartphone from Xiaomi , dubbed as Xiaomi Mi MIX Evo, has now been spotted on benchmark website Geekbench. As per the specifications listed on Geekbench, it appears that the smartphone is a high-end device as it packs a capable processor in the form of Snapdragon 835 SoC. 
According to the Geekbench listing , the Xiaomi Mi MIX Evo smartphone is powered by a Qualcomm MSM8998 (Snapdragon 835) processor coupled with 4GB of RAM. The listing suggests that the smartphone runs Android 6.0.1 Marshmallow and the peak clock speed of the octa-core processor is clocked at 1.9GHz. 
Even though the listing doesn't reveal more details about the phone, its name suggests that this might be a possible variant of company's near bezel-less display smartphone- Xiaomi Mi MIX . The listing was first spotted by GSMArena. 
To recall, Xiaomi launched the Mi MIX smartphone as a limited edition handset in October last year. The phone features 91.3 percent screen-to-body ratio and is powered by a 2.35GHz quad-core Snapdragon 821 SoC, coupled with 4GB/ 6GB of LPDDR4 RAM. In terms of optics, Xiaomi has included a 16-megapixel rear camera with PDAF, f/2.0 aperture, and dual-tone LED flash. It comes with a 5-megapixel camera at front for taking selfies. 
The connectivity options on the Mi MIX smartphone include 4G LTE, a GPS/ A-GPS, NFC with Mi Pay support, Bluetooth v4.2, Wi-Fi 802.11ac, and a USB Type-C port. 
At CES 2017 earlier this month, Xiaomi announced a new Mi MIX white colour variant, which will be launched in China later this year.
